did.abstract: Diary and pass of D. Alonzo Smith, member of Company C, 19th Connecticut Regiment.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: D. Alonzo Smith was born about 1838 in Connecticut (possibly New Britain) and served in Company C, 19th Connecticut Regiment during the American Civil War. He enlisted in 1862 (Torrington, Connecticut) and served until at least June 1865 (date of the pass). In the Census records (1860-1880), Smith is listed as residing in Torrington. About 1874, Smith married Sarah Ann Loser and they had one child, Clara Louise, who was born about 1878. Smith died prior to the 1900 Census, as Sarah is listed as a widow.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a handwritten diary recounting D. Alonzo Smith's activities during the American Civil War from the time of his enlistment in Torrington, Connecticut. The entries include information regarding his work as a prison guard at Fort Ellsworth, Virginia.
The original pass has been removed from the collection because it is fragile and a copy provided.
